Class Main

  • java.lang.Object
    • Main

  • @NotThreadSafe
public class Main
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to initialize and run the program. Upon initialization, this class loads properties files, sets the LookAndFeel of the GUI, initializes models, controllers, and other critical elements, and starts the GUI on the EventDispatchThread. When the program is finished, it saves any property changes so they are available for future runs.

    This class is not thread-safe. It should only be run as the Main thread for the program, and should not be accessed by any other threads during runtime.
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Craig

      private static void configureLanguageModule()
      Configures the Language module with a Locale based on the saved language setting in the user.properties file.

      If the userProperties field has not been instantiated yet, this method will do nothing, as it has no function as long as that field is null.

      Configure the properties of the main logger.

      Loads the default properties file as a resource stream from the classloader.
      private static void loadUserProperties() 
      private static void loggingWontSavePopup()
      If the logger's FileHandler fails to properly initialize (most likely due to an IOException), this popup appears to warn the user that Debugging Mode will not work.

      Because this message can appear so early in the program, it is locked as English-Only because the user will not have had an opportunity to set an alternate language yet.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main method to begin running the StockMarket program.
      private static void saveUserProperties(java.io.File userPropertiesFile)
      Saves a brand new user.properties file to the save directory.

      If the user.properties file had to be created for the first time when the loadUserProperties() method ran, this method should be called to save the file for future use.

      If the userProperties field has not yet been instantiated, this method will do nothing, as it has no function as long as that field has a null value.

    • Field Detail

      • LOGGER

        private static final java.util.logging.Logger LOGGER
        The logger for this program. With the exception of the default root logger, this is the top of the logger hierarchy. It needs to be configured prior to the launch of the program to have the necessary Levels and Handlers set.

        public Main()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method to begin running the StockMarket program. Calls on static methods in this class to initialize and assemble the various components of the program. When everything is ready to run, it initializes the GUI.
        Parameters:
        args - command line arguments that may be passed to this program.

      • verifyDirectory

        private static boolean verifyDirectory()
        Verifies that the program is able to properly access a save location on the filesystem before running. This method should be run before any other when the program is initialized.

        99.9% of the time this method will return true, and the program can proceed normally from here.

        In the rare case that it returns false, it likely means that there is some issue with the JVM's ability to read the filesystem of the OS this program is running on. The program should response to this method returning false by giving the user an error message and shutting down.
        Returns:
        whether the program could establish a save directory on the hosts filesystem.

      • filesystemConnectionFailPopup

        private static void filesystemConnectionFailPopup()
        This method is only invoked in the extremely rare case that the program fails to set up a save location on the file system. It creates a popup window with an error message to inform the user that such a serious issue has occurred and the program will now terminate.

        Because this message can appear so early in the program, it is locked as English-Only because the user will not have had an opportunity to set an alternate language yet.

      • configureLogger

        private static void configureLogger()
        Configure the properties of the main logger. Because the logger in the Main class will be at the root of the hierarchy, all logging events will ultimately be passed to it. The settings on this logger determine how all logging will be recorded for the entire program.

      • loggingWontSavePopup

        private static void loggingWontSavePopup()
        If the logger's FileHandler fails to properly initialize (most likely due to an IOException), this popup appears to warn the user that Debugging Mode will not work.

        Because this message can appear so early in the program, it is locked as English-Only because the user will not have had an opportunity to set an alternate language yet.

      • loadDefaultProperties

        private static void loadDefaultProperties()
        Loads the default properties file as a resource stream from the classloader.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the file doesn't load properly and has no contents.

      • loadUserProperties

        private static void loadUserProperties()

      • saveUserProperties

        private static void saveUserProperties(java.io.File userPropertiesFile)
        Saves a brand new user.properties file to the save directory.

        If the user.properties file had to be created for the first time when the loadUserProperties() method ran, this method should be called to save the file for future use.

        If the userProperties field has not yet been instantiated, this method will do nothing, as it has no function as long as that field has a null value.

      • configureLanguageModule

        private static void configureLanguageModule()
        Configures the Language module with a Locale based on the saved language setting in the user.properties file.

        If the userProperties field has not been instantiated yet, this method will do nothing, as it has no function as long as that field is null.

      • setLookAndFeel

        private static void setLookAndFeel()
        Set the LookAndFeel for the UIManager. Must be invoked prior to initializing the GUI.
